Articles.Content:
hello,

I don't know if it's a feature or a misstake /bug, but my kerbal can survive a crash from a 10 000m EVA!

what i do to reproduce:

-go in EVA at 10 000m

-set the jetpack "on" and play a bit

-whatch the kerbal bouncing (sometime not )

-Waoooow he is alive!

5pics:

 [http://imgur.com/2Ups6Va,xKdJO3c,Dg6TEBd,JL5w7Aq,66fuUFq#0](http://imgur.com/2Ups6Va,xKdJO3c,Dg6TEBd,JL5w7Aq,66fuUFq#0)

what do you think about it? can you do the same? 

 has it ever been reported before?

Edit:

1-Sorry if i'm in the wrong section (thank's sal\_vager)

2-config:

 win 7 64bits,

Fresh and stock KSP 1.0.0.830 from Steam!!!(32 bits)

3-add experiments:

atmosphere doesnt matter ( i did it on the MunÃ‚Â© too), nor on land or on water

gender (new character) doesnt matter, Valentina is bouncing too

warping before or during the crash doesnt matter

set the *jet pack mode "on"* matter, if not kerbals vanishing in the small smoke

4-changing tittle beacon to : **[support - Windows]**

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-27T19:55:53Z" title="04/27/2015 07:55  PM" data-short="9 yr">April 27, 2015</time> by Skalou**

Yes, happens all the time. Is it the jetpack that causes it?

Also, wrong forum, I'm afraid ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

Does this go into development discussion?

Some have speculated that the Kerbal, or Kerbolus Krackenius, evolved and became the dominate form of life due to their abnormally large brains.

Careful dissection and examination of the Kerbal cranium revealed something entirely different. Their heads are made of rubber, allowing them to survive even the most gruesome of blows should they land on their head.

what should i do now? 

i wish an ancient player/moderator can answer here, and repport it if necessary to the game developpers.

if you need, you can contact me in private message
